#BENEFITS_OF_CHARCOAL!

Charcoal is one of the most disregarded products at home. We only see the need for it when it is time to set fire for Banku.
However, if you really need first aid, charcoal is something you need to have on you all the time. You might not know this but it is one of the most medicinal products you can have at home due to its poison extraction ability.
In case you never gave it much attention, this is the time to do so. Here are *13* benefits of charcoal you never thought about.

1. *#Preventing_Odour*.
Does your shoe smell bad? Just get some charcoal & put it in them. Do you have any bad smell in your room? Drop some charcoal where you suspect the smell could be coming from. Does your fridge or freezer smell? Put a piece of charcoal in it. Do you have strong body odour? Just make a powder out of charcoal & use.
Charcoal is very good at getting rid of bad smell. Ever wondered why your parents always scooped out the ash from the coal pot to pour in the hen coop or toilet before sweeping? That was to get rid of the odour.

2. *#Keeping_Food_Fresh*.
If you want your vegetables to be fresh all the time, just make a solution out of charcoal & leave your vegetables in them. Thank us later.

3. *#Removing_Toxins_From_Food*.
These days, people complain about the use of fertilizers on plants & vegetables, making them unwholesome & poisonous. If you have charcoal, you don’t need to worry about this. All you need to do is leave the vegetables in a charcoal solution overnight & it’ll take care of the toxins. If you suspect any food contains too many chemicals, just drop them in a charcoal solution for some hours & you’re good to go.

4. *#For_Teeth_Whitening*.
If you want to whiten your teeth, pay no attention to all these adverts on whitening chemicals & technology.Just get yourself some charcoal & grab hold of a plantain stalk. Make a powder out of the charcoal, mash the tip of the plantain stalk, dip it into the charcoal powder & brush your teeth with it.

DIY Rosemary essential oil

• Cut enough fresh rosemary to fill your Mason jar.

•Wash the rosemary in water, and allow to completely dry under sun for a day to avoid the oil going rancid.

•Place the dried rosemary leaves in the jar and fill it with olive oil, until the rosemary is completely covered. Secure the lid on the jar.

• Place the jar in a sunny window for about 2weeks.

• Strain the infused oil into a clean jar.

BENEFITS OF FENUGREEK SEEDS

Skin Benefits

1. Have Anti-Aging Effects
Fenugreek seeds can have surprising benefits for your skin, including eliminating the signs of aging like wrinkles and fine lines.
What you need: 1 tablespoon fenugreek seeds soaked overnight 1 tablespoon plain yogurt.
Procedure: Blend the fenugreek seeds and yogurt till a smooth paste is formed,apply this paste on your face and Keep it on for 30 minutes and then rinse with cold water.

2. Cure Acne
Those who are suffering from acne can give fenugreek seeds a try because they are very effective in getting rid of acne
What you need: 4 tablespoons fenugreek seeds soaked overnight in water
4 cups water
Procedure: Add the fenugreek seeds to water and let it simmer for 15 minutes, Strain the water and let it cool. Using a cotton wool, dab the water onto your face twice a day. Store the excess in the refrigerator.

Hair Benefits
3. Promotes Hair growth and Adds shine
Fenugreek is extremely effective in strengthening the hair from the roots and treating follicular problems.
Ingredient: 1 tablespoon fenugreek seeds and 1 cup coconut oil
Procedure: Place the coconut oil and fenugreek seeds in a mason jar. Seal the jar and store it for three weeks in a cool place, away from direct sunlight. Strain the oil and use it for oil massages.

4. Fight Dandruff
Dandruff is a common hair ailment, and it generally surfaces during winter.
There are various treatments and procedures to treat dandruff. One of the most basic and effective cures is using methi(fenugreek) seeds. They are also an effective cure for dry scalp and dermatitis.

5. Prevent Premature Graying
A part of folk medicine, fenugreek seeds have been used for a long time to prevent the graying of hair.

Health Benefits

6. Help Control Diabetes
Diabetics are often recommended to include fenugreek seeds in their diet because of the positive effects they can have on their health.

7.Increases Breast size
 Fenugreek seeds have been used by women to increase their breast size. This herb contains phytoestrogen that boosts oestogen levels. Drinking fenugreek tea seems to increase the size of breast. 

8. Help Prevent Cancer
Studies have shown that the oil extracted from fenugreek seeds can help fight against cancer.

9. Alleviate Menstrual Cramps
Studies have shown that fenugreek seeds can also help in reducing the pain of menstrual cramps as well as other symptoms associated with menstruation.

10. Prevent Heart Attacks

HOW TO MAKE AVOCADO OIL

• Get a ripe avocado fruit.

• Scrap and mash the flesh of your avocado till there are no lumps.

• Pour in your olive oil into the mashed avocado and mix thoroughly. Keep in a tight jar till you notice the oil colour change to green.

• Strain the oil and you have your avocado oil.

HOW TO MAKE BASE CREAM 

1 Cup emulsifying wax 
1 cup steric acid
½ cup cetyl alcohol 
Coconut oil 60ml 
Vitamin E oil 20ml 
Water 800ml 
Glycerin 30ml 
Preservative 25ml 
Glycolic acid 30ml

METHOD:
• In a double boiler (place a wide pot on fire with water and put a thick glass bowl on it) melt your wax, steric acid, cetyl alcohol and oil together. While at that, heat your water on a separate stove, bring water down to be cooling down while waiting for the wax to melt. When well melted, drop it down and turn it into a large bowl (to enable you mix well).

• Pour your liquid gradually into the oil as you mix with your hand mixer to get a creamy texture. 

•Add your glycering, Vitamin E oil, preservative and mix thoroughly. Your base cream is ready.
 Store in a air tight container.

Uses of avocado oil

•Prevents Sun Damage

•Fights Signs Of Aging

Avocado oil has benefits not just for a sun-damaged skin but any skin that shows the signs of natural aging like wrinkles, dryness, and flaccidity.

Vitamin E and lecithin in avocado help boost the collagen in the skin, giving it firmness.Vitamin E and carotenoids also prevent inflammation and keep wrinkles from showing on the skin.The fatty acids in avocado oil penetrate into the second layer of the skin, moisturizing it well and preventing aging-related dryness and wrinkles.

Just dab some cold-pressed organic avocado oil on your face at night and wake up to hydrated and smooth skin in the morning.

Tip: Mix 2 tsps of avocado oil with 1/2 tsp castor oil for cleaning away makeup. This is a safe and gentle alternative to the harsh alcohol-based makeup cleansers that disturb the acidic balance of the skin.

• Reduces Dark Circles

•Helps Hair Regrowth

Apart from its monounsaturated fats like oleic acid that moisturize the scalp, avocado oil contains vitamin D, which is crucial for the generation of new hair follicles.

Apply avocado oil onto your scalp and massage well.

•Fights Dandruff

•Avocado oil can also cure dandruff caused by psoriasis.

 •Improves Nail.

•Lowers Risk Of Heart Disease

The fatty acids and the plant sterols in avocado oil make it good for people with high cholesterol. 

•Fights Inflammation

The bulk of the fat found in avocado oil is oleic acid. Oleic acid reduces inflammation in the body. 

• Improves Symptoms Of Arthritis

 avocado is the fruit to eat to relieve the symptoms of osteoarthritis, a painful condition that causes inflammation of the joints. Besides oleic acid, the carotenoid lutein and vitamin E in avocado oil can help alleviate symptoms with their anti-inflammatory properties help lower the risk of joint damage.

•Increases Absorption Of Certain Nutrients

It helps to drizzle some avocado oil on your fruit salads or cook your carrots in

COCONUT LIGHTENING LOTION

1tsp emulsifying wax
1tsp stearic acid
1tsp kojic acid dip
1tsp snow white powder
1tsp citric acid
1tsp Giga white powder
2tbsp Almond oil
1tbsp virgin coconut oil
100ml coconut water
1tbsp distilled water
Coconut fragrance
Lemon essential oil
1tsp preservative

Procedure

• In a glass jar add steric acid, E wax, almond oil and coconut oil to melt on a double boiler.

• Extract coconut water out, measure 100ml and warm it.

• In a bowl, add all the powder and dissolve with 1tbsp distilled water to get a smooth paste.

• When the oil is melted,  pour the coconut water into the melted oil and whisk with a hand mixer gradually add the dissolved powders and whisk together.

• Add the preservative, 20 drops of coconut fragrance oil and 10 drops of lemon essential oil and whip for 2 more minutes to fully incorporate.
Your coconut lightening lotion is ready.

NOTE: FOR THOSE THAT DOESN'T WANT TO LIGHTENING, YOU CAN SKIP KOJIC ACID, SNOW WHITE AND GIGA WHITE.

Extra whitening gold shower gel

Ingredients

1 cup Castile liquid soap 
1 tbsp honey
2 tbsp grape seed/ jojoba/almond/olive oil 
1 tsp vitamin e oil
3 tsp lycopene
2 tsp sym white
2 tsp giga white
2 tsp gold whitening powder
30 drops of essential oils (your choice)

Procedure

•Dissolve all powder with glycerin/rosewater/water, mix thoroughly into paste avoiding lumps

•Measure out all ingredients and combine in a bowl stir very well until incorporated and pour into desire bottles.

NOTE:
To get the desired effect of any soap, you don't pour directly on sponge. You wet your body, apply soap on the body for some minutes then sponge and rinse off.

GLOWING CREAM

INGREDIENTS

1tbsp emulsifying  wax 
20ml of grape seed oil
70ml water
1tbsp glycerin
2tsp rose oil
2tsp almond oil
2tbsp aloe vera gel
2tsp green tea
2tsp vitamin E oil
2tbsp lavender flower juice
2tsp of any orange essential oil 
1ml preservative

METHOD

• On a double boiler melt your oil and wax

• Next, warm your water on the heat

•  Pour your water and glycerin gradually into the melted oil.

• Whip till you get a creamy texture.

• After doing this add  aloe vera, green tea , lavender juice and orange essential oil , preservative and mix till fluffy and your cream is ready.

Mango Body Butter

Ingredients

4tbs of organic unrefined mango butter
1tbs of organic refined shea butter
2 tbs of organic safflower oil
½ teaspoon of arrowroot powder (optional)
5 drops of roman chamomile essential oil
3 drops of bergamot essential oil 

Instructions

• Put the shea and mango butter in a glass or metal bowl inside a pan filled with water on low heat so they start melting slowly.Once melted add the safflower oil and mix well.

•Put the bowl in the freezer for 5 to 10 minutes, depending on the temperature of your freezer. You want the mixture to not be completely frozen but thick enough so it is not liquid.If its a soft paste then its ready to whip!Then take it out of the freezer and start whipping with an electric whip on low speed.
• Add the arrowroot powder if desired. This is optional but will help have a light feeling and texture on the skin. Begin whipping your mixture on low speed until it becomes fluffy. Once the mixture is fluffy, increase the speed to medium until it becomes whipped to the desired stage.

• Add essential oils if desired at the end and whip for 1 min or less.Your butter will have a very fluffy and light consistency, like a nice whipped cream!

*Tumeric scrub*

Ingredients

2 tbsp Sugar

2 tsp. Turmeric Powder

50ml Olive Oil

60ml Natural Castile Liquid Soap Base

1ml Orange Essential oil

0.3 oz. Optiphen

Instructions

•In a small container, mix the olive oil, Natural Castile Liquid Soap Base,  essential oil, and Optiphen. Stir to thoroughly mix the ingredients and set the container aside. 

NOTE ABOUT PRESERVATIVES: Although this scrub doesn’t contain water, it will likely get splashed in during use. The extra water may cause bacteria and mold to grow. The preservative us added preservative to be extra careful, but it is optional. 

•In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar and turmeric powder. Stir them together to fully combine .

•Pour the oil mixture into the sugar. Use your hands or a spatula to thoroughly mix.

Transfer the mixture into the jars. To use, apply to wet skin, scrub in circular motions, and rinse off.

NATURAL HOMEMADE SUNSCREEN

INGREDIENTS:
1/4 tsp coconut oil
4 tsp shea butter
1/4 jojoba, sesame, or sunflower oil 
1/4 Vitamin E oil 
15 drops lavender E.O
10 drops eucalyptus  E.O
5 drops peppermint E.O
1 tsp zinc oxide powder.

DIRECTIONS:

• Make a double boiler coconut oil, shea butter, and jojoba/sesame/sunflower oil . (To make your own double boiler, place a Pyrex measuring cup containing ingredients inside a small pot filled with 2inches  of water). Heat until melted. Remove from double boiler and allow to cool a little.

• Put on a mask that covers your nose and mouth (to avoid breathing in the fine particles of zinc oxide powder), and measure out your zinc oxide. Add zinc oxide, Vitamin E oil, and the essential oils to the melted oil and whip till fluffy

•Store in airtight container.

DIY BANANA OIL 

Banana oil is an essential incorporation of various moisturizers, creams, hair masks and scents. It is ideally processed at factories. However, you can also make real banana oil using banana peels at home. 

METHOD

•Cut fresh banana peels into small chunks. Place the chunks in a plastic bag. Gently hit the bag enough times with a mallet to bruise the banana peels.

•Put the bruised chunks of peel in a glass jar and fill with sweet almond oil. The almond oil will help draw out the oils in the banana peel. Place the lid tightly on the jar. 

•Shake the jar then place it in a warm window sill for two weeks. Give the jar a shake periodically throughout the two weeks. If the scent isn't strong enough,

Place a new batch of bruised chunks of banana peels in the oil. Allow it to soak for two more days then strain the oil again, back into the first jar.

•Continue the process of soaking consecutive batches of banana peels in the same oil, alternating the jars, until the desired strength of banana aroma is achieved.

PIMPLES/ACNE REMEDIES
Learn how to get clear skin with this simple home remedies... 

Aspirin: The salicylic acid in aspirin is a go-to for acne treatments, and the aspirin can dry up pimples and reduce inflammation. To take advantage of its benefits, form a paste by mashing aspirin in a little water, or dissolve four pills in 2 tablespoons of water. Apply it on your face every night

Mint: can help remove pore-clogging oil. To help clear acne before it begins, mix 2 tablespoons of finely chopped fresh mint with two tablespoons each of plain yogurt and oatmeal (use a blender to pulverize the oatmeal to powder). Leave the concoction on your face for 10 minutes, then rinse off with water.

Honey: antibiotic properties can help improve acne. Apply a teaspoon of honey to affected areas, or make a mask by mixing 1/2 cup of honey with 1 cup of plain oatmeal and leaving it on for 30 minutes.

Steaming: is wonderful for your skin at any time, but particularly when you have pimples. The steam will open your pores and allow your skin to breathe. This helps get rid of oils, dirt and bacteria trapped in the pores that can cause infection or inflammation.
Fill a large container with hot water and allow the steam to come in contact with your face for a few minutes. Rinse your face with lukewarm water and after drying, apply an oil-free moisturizer.

1tsp sunflower oil,
1 &1/2 tsp bee pollen, granules,

Method

Benefits of Banana oil for Skin

•Banana oil is good for dry and flaky skin. It deeply nourishes dry skin by restoring the normal PH level of the skin. It also repairs chapped skin and moisturizes the deeper skin layers too.

•Banana oil offers sun protection to the skin as well. It armours the skin against dullness, dryness and darkening caused due to sun exposure. It can also reverse the effects of sun damage alongside preventing them from happening.

•Banana oil is an amazing anti-ageing therapy against premature skin ageing. It reduces the appearance of lines and wrinkles on the face. It tightens the skin cells and tissues by triggering the formation of collagen fibers in skin. This ensures that the skin becomes younger, radiant and supple once again.

•Banana oil tones the skin and makes it blemish-free too. Thus, you can flaunt an even complexion that is free of blemishes, age spots and pigmentation with the regular and controlled use of banana oil.This makes your skin tone better than before.

 Banana Oil Benefits For Hair:

• Banana oil is also an effective hair smoothening remedy. It can be heated and applied to dry and weak hair.It offers deep conditioning to dry and dull hair by restoring the normal PH level of the scalp.

• Banana oil is an effective anti-dandruff remedy that keeps you free from dandruff. It reduces the scalp’s oiliness and also keeps a check on its dryness. In other words, it maintains the scalp’s health. In turn, the scalp gets rid of problems like acne and dandruff.

•Banana oil is also an amazing solution to make hair frizz-free and manageable. It offers lustre and volume to dull and thin hair. It protects hair cuticles and keratin against damage caused due to pollution and the sun.

•Banana oil also helps in hair growth and fights against hair thinning and baldness. It makes the hair roots stronger. This also keeps a check on hair fall. Thus, it is an amazing solution for people suffering from the problem of excessive hair fall.

*BLACK SOAP FOR BABIES*

 Ingredients
1pack Black soap
Shea butter 3 tablespoons 2tablespoon of glycerin 3 tablespoons jojoba oil
coconut oil
2 tablespoons of almond oil 
2 tablespoons of sulphur 
2 tablespoons of castor oil 
2 tablespoons of aloe Vera gel 
2 tablespoons of camwood (osun in Yoruba)/sandalwood or both 
2tsp of potash

 Procedure 

Get a mortar cut your black soap in pieces & pound well, add up your ingredients after that pour in your soap container
 You can add rose water if it's too hard

USES OF COCONUT WATER

•AS SKIN MOISTURIZER: coconut water does wonders to the skin, it’s a great moisturizer for oily skin. it hydrate the skin. Just apply some coconut water on the skin and allow it to absorb.

•AS SUN TAN REMOVAL: The application of coconut water on the skin helps fade sun tan.

COCONUT WATER  FOR FAIRER SKIN  
 
•As a face scrub, mix 2tsp of coconut water with 1tsp of rice flour  together and use it to scrub the face, it lightens the skin and gives young glowing skin.

•As a face pack; mix 2tsp of gram flour , add a pinch of turmeric powder and some coconut water to make a paste. Apply this on your face as a mask, leave it to dry and wash off with lukewarm water. Use this 3-4 times a week to get fairer skin tone.

•FOR GLOWING SKIN
 Mix 3tsp of coconut water and 1tsp of glycerin apply it on your face and leave it for 30min and discover an instant glowing skin

•SKIN TONIC FOR DRY SKIN  mix 10tsp of coconut water, 10tsp of rosewater and 2tsp of glycerin. Store it in a small a bottle and refrigerate, use twice a day to hydrate the dry dull skin, just take 6-7 drops and massage on  your skin it can be use up to 7 days after that make a fresh batch.

African black soap

*Ingredients*

Cocoa pods

Palm kernel oil

Shea butter

Palm leaves

Coconut oil

Plantain leaves

Potash

Virgin olive oil

Naturally-occurring glycerin

 *Procedure*

• Burn the plantain skins and cocoa pods together. Collect the ashes and place them into a bowl.

• Add distilled water while continuously stirring the mixture. Add ashes and water until you reach your desired consistency.

•Heat the oil in the boiler until it reaches a liquid and smooth consistency. Add the ash mixture and continue stirring until the entire mixture turns into a deep dark brown. Keep the burner in low heat and continue stirring.

*Note*: if you want to add a little bit of fragrance to the mix, you can add one or two drops of lavender oil. You can also add dried plant parts to add to the scent and texture.

•You will see films of the liquid soap forming on the sides of the boiler. Scoop them up and transfer them into molds. Pack the soaps into the molds and leave it to harden in the molds for up to 2 weeks.

exfoliating coffee soap

Ingredients

13.9 oz. Olive Oil(45%)
8.3 oz.Coconut Oil(25%)
8.3 oz. Palm Oil (25%)
1.7 oz. Shea Butter (5%)
1 oz. Coffee Oil (3%)
5 oz. Brewed Coffee
5 oz. Distilled Water
4.6 oz. Sodium Hydroxide Lye
2 Tbsp. Coffee Grounds
Whole Coffee Beans (for the top)

Instructions

Note: Suit up for safe handling practices! That means goggles, gloves and long sleeves, because lye is corrossive

•COFFEE LYE PREP: First prepare the lye solution. We are using half coffee and half distilled water. Brew the coffee using distilled water. The strength of the coffee is up to you. The stronger it is, the darker your soap batter will be.  brew enough coffee for the entire recipe (5 ounces) which resulted in a rich, dark color. Measure 5 ounces of coffee into the container you use to mix the lye solution. Add 5 ounces of distilled water to the coffee, which needs to cool to room temperature or below before adding the lye. 

•Slowly and carefully add the lye to the water-coffee mixture, and gently stir until the lye has fully dissolved

Orange Body Scrub

Ingredients

8 oz. Liquid Castile soap
2 oz. Shea Butter
6 oz. Granulated Sugar
1 oz orange peel powder
0.2 oz. Orange Fragrance Oil

Instructions

•In a large mixing bowl, add the liquid castile soap and shea butter. Use a hand mixer to beat together until smooth.Add the Orange Fragrance Oil. Turn the beater on low, and mix until combined.

•Add the granulated sugar and orange peel powder and use the hand mixer on low to fully incorporate all the ingredients.Once the scrub is completely smooth and combined, transfer it to jars. 

•To use, apply to wet skin and scrub.

*Pink lips balm*

Ingredients

1.5 oz. Castor Oil.
4 oz Jojoba Oil.
2 oz beewax
3 mL Rose Fragrance
2 tsp beetroot powder, or red food colouring

*Procedure*

*In a heat safe container, add the castor and jojoba oils. Add the beewax and heat in the microwave using 30 second bursts until the wax is fully melted. 

•Add 3 mL of Rose Fragrance and use a spoon to fully mix in.Add the beetroot powderand use a spoon to fully incorporate.Once fully blended, allow the mixture to cool slightly. Once the mixture has cooled slightly, carefully pour the lip gloss mixture into the lip balm containers.

• Allow to fully cool and place the cap on top.
